item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "Even this nation (the US) will be on the very verge of crumbling to pieces and tumbling to the ground, and when the Constitution is upon the brink of ruin, this people will be the staff upon which the nation shall lean, and they shall bear the Constitution away from the very verge of destruction." -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "We say, that the Constitution of the United States is a glorious standard; it is founded in the wisdom of God." -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "We say that God is true; that the Constitution of the United States is true; that the Bible is true; and that the Book of Mormon is true, and that Christ is true" -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith, Jr.
item.description: "It is our duty to concentrate all our influence to make popular that which is sound and good, and unpopular that which is unsound. " -- Joseph Smith, Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith
item.description: "A man filled with the love of God, is not content with blessing his family alone, but ranges through the whole world, anxious to bless the whole human race." -- Joseph Smith

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "The Lord did strengthen them that they could bear up their burdens with ease, and they did submit cheerfully and with patience to all the will of the Lord." -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "Nothing is so much calculated to lead people to forsake sin as to take them by the hand and to watch over them in tenderness. When persons manifest the least kindness and love to me, O what pow'r it has over my mind." -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Inspiration usually comes during work rather than before it." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "I do not know everything; still many things I understand." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Humility is throwing oneself away in complete concentration on something or someone else." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "The unending paradox is that we do learn through pain." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "But unless we are creators we are not fully alive. What do I mean by creators? Not only artists, whose acts of creation are the obvious ones of working with paint of clay or words. Creativity is a way of living life, no matter our vocation or how we earn our living. Creativity is not limited to the arts, or having some kind of important career." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Don't try to comprehend with your mind. Your minds are very limited. Use your intuition." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeline L'Engle
item.description: "Because to take away a man's freedom of choice, even his freedom to make the wrong choice, is to manipulate him as though he were a puppet and not a person." -- Madeline L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A straight line is not the shortest distance between two points." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by madeline L'engel
item.description: "God understands that part of us which is more than what we think we are." -- madeline L'engel

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "In reading we must become creators." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "The truth is that our finest moments are most likely to occur when we are feeling deeply uncomfortable, unhappy, or unfulfilled. For it is only in such moments, propelled by our discomfort, that we are likely to step out of our ruts and start searching for different ways or truer answers." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "We must be willing to fail and to appreciate the truth that often "Life is not a problem to be solved, but a mystery to be lived." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Genuine love is volitional rather than emotional. The person who truely loves does so because of a decision to love. This person has made a commitment to be loving whether or not the loving feeling is present. ...Conversely, it is not only possible but necessary for a loving person to avoid acting on feelings of love." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "How strange that we should ordinarily feel compelled to hide our wounds when we are all wounded! Community requires the ability to expose our wounds and weaknesses to our fellow creatures. It also requires the ability to be affected by the wounds of others... But even more important is the love that arises among us when we share, both ways, our woundedness." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "It is only because of problems that we grow mentally and spiritually. " -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Whenever we seek to avoid the responsibility for our own behavior, we do so by attempting to give that responsibility to some other individual or organization or entity. But this means we then give away our power to that entity. " -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Love is the will to extend one's self for the purpose of nurturing one's own or another's spiritual growth... Love is as love does. Love is an act of will -- namely, both an intention and an action. Will also implies choice. We do not have to love. We choose to love." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Since [narcissists] deep down, feel themselves to be faultless, it is inevitable that when they are in conflict with the world they will invariably perceive the conflict as the world's fault. Since they must deny their own badness, they must perceive others as bad. They project their own evil onto the world. They never think of themselves as evil, on the other hand, they consequently see much evil in others." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Scott Peck
item.description: "If we know exactly where we're going, exactly how to get there, and exactly what we'll see along the way, we won't learn anything. " -- Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by Scott Peck
item.description:
"Consciousness and Healing
To proceed very far through the desert, you must be willing to meet existential suffering and work it through. In order to do this, the attitude toward pain has to change. This happens when we accept the fact that everything that happens to us has been designed for our spiritual growth." -- Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it. " -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Life is difficult. This is a great truth, one of the greatest truths. It is a great truth because once we truly see this truth, we transcend it. Once we truly know that life is difficult-once we truly understand and accept it-then life is no longer difficult. Because once it is accepted, the fact that life is difficult no longer matters." -- M. Scott Peck

item.title: Jeanine add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "There is no virtue inherent in un-constructive suffering." -- M. Scott Peck
